search.searchResults.title: Search results
search.fromsearchResults.title: Guided query
smart.mode.examples.title: Common searches
smart.mode.example.add: Add this sample in the search field
smart.mode.notificationText.jumpToSearch: to jump to the search box
smart.mode.help._intro_title: Guided mode helps you build complex queries with ease, hides complexity in building UQL query.
smart.mode.help._intro_line_3: Its a sports car, manufactured by Porsche, launched in summer of 1999, with 375 kW Horsepower, model "2023 Porsche 911". If we break this info into properties
smart.mode.help._intro_line_5: So, if you are looking for this car in a database, you can do that in many ways but here are a few ways
smart.mode.help._intro_query_1: cars with speed > 300 And manufactered by porsche
smart.mode.help._intro_query_2: sports car And launched in year 1999 with horsepower > 300
smart.mode.help._intro_line_6: This feature guides you build these types of complex queries. You got to identify such featues/properties and corresponding tagvalues construct a condition and connect such conditions with operators to build you query.
smart.mode.help._headers_line_1: At each turn, you will be presented with suggestions, which will let you build query with ease. These suggestions are context sensitive, that means, you will see suggestions based on bricks selected.
smart.mode.help._headers_content_1_line_: Ex: Title, Owner, Maturity State, Creation date are tags &
"Pirates of the Caribbean", "Bernard Charles", "In Work", "2024/07/08" are corresponding tag values
smart.mode.help._headers_content_2_line_: This is a special property, used to classify the object on the platform just like Post, Wikipage, Part, Physical Product etc. And since type tag is frequently used, a dedicated section for Types is provided.
smart.mode.help._headers_content_3_line_: These are extension of types, i.e., they have all the tags of the type and also have some additional tags of their own(just like the example, car & sport car). Ex: Physical Product(type) and Angle Pin(extension of "Physical Product")
smart.mode.help._headers_content_4_line_: Today, this week, this month, this year, last year - corrresponding to timeline
smart.mode.help._headers_content_5_line_: Ex: And, Or  -  Used to connect conditions
To connect tag and a tag values
smart.mode.help._headers_content_6_line_: @username or @userID to see user suggestions. [Limitation: user should have access to swym source to see these suggestion]
smart.mode.help._headers_content_7_line_: Whenever a community is in focus (community should be selected with "IN" refine OR "ds6w:community" tag), you will br presented with community tags of the community.
smart.mode.help._headers_content_8_line_: #company tags to see matching company tags.
smart.mode.help._navigate_content_1_part: arrows to move in the query/input field.
smart.mode.help._navigate_content_2_part: to see key tips. User can combine the Key Tips letters with the Alt key to use shortcuts
smart.mode.help._navigate_content_3_line: If a suggestion is in focus in Suggestions list, hitting Tab/Enter will validate the brick in the query. if nothing is in focus, search will be launched.
smart.mode.help._navigate_content_4_part: When you are lost in the UI, entering
will take you to the search field.
smart.mode.help._navigate_content_5_line: To get rid of last selected brick in Search field.
smart.mode.help._navigate_content_6_line: Clicking on "Esc" will get you out of Guided Mode
smart.mode.help._operator_content_1_line: When no operator is present between 2 conditions, it is interpreted as if they are connected by "AND" operator. [With the exception that between two types it is "OR"].
smart.mode.help._operator_content_2_line: Between 2 types, if operator isn't present it is interpreted as OR operator.
smart.mode.help._operator_content_3_line: Between Tag and Tag Value, if operator isn't present it is interpreted as contains.
